Module TradingSimulator.project
Package Universe

Enum Class World

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<World>
Universe.World
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<World>, Constable
public enum World extends Enum<World>
The singleton class representing the world, it contains all entities and parameters involved in trading; the parameters are already set but can be modified by the user through the GUI.

    • addInvestor

      public void addInvestor()
      Adds an investor to the world's observable map 'investors'.

    • addInvestmentFund

      public void addInvestmentFund()
      Adds an investment fund to the world's observable map 'investmentFunds'. Note: An investment fund can be created only if there is at least stock market in the world.

    • update

      public void update()
      Maintains the ratio between available assets and the number of investors/investment funds; creates investing entities if needed.

    • createMoreInvestors

      private void createMoreInvestors(int n)
      Creates a specified number of investors.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of investors to be created.

    • createMoreInvestmentFunds

      private void createMoreInvestmentFunds(int n)
      Creates a specified number of investment funds.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of investment funds to be created.

    • removeAsset

      public void removeAsset(String assetName)
      Removes a specified asset from the world.
      Parameters:
      assetName - A String containing the name of an asset to be removed.

    • getMarkets

      public javafx.collections.ObservableMap<String,Market> getMarkets()
      Gets the world's markets.
      Returns:
      An observable map representing all world's markets where market names serve as keys.

    • getMarketNames

      public Map<String,javafx.collections.ObservableList<String>> getMarketNames()
      Gets the world's market names divided into three categories with respect to types of markets.
      Returns:
      An observable map representing all world's markets names categorized.

    • getMarketNamesList

      public List<String> getMarketNamesList()
      Gets the world's market names.
      Returns:
      A list of world's market names.

    • getCompanies

      public javafx.collections.ObservableMap<String,Company> getCompanies()
      Gets the world's companies.
      Returns:
      An observable map of world's companies where companies names serve as keys.

    • performBuyOut

      public void performBuyOut(Company c, float targetAmount)
      Performs a buyout operation, i.e. a company's attempt to buy back its own shares.
      Parameters:
      c - A company on which a buyout operation will be performed.
      targetAmount - The amount of shares that will be attempted to buy back.

      public int getSecondsElapsed()
      Gets the number of seconds elapsed.
      Returns:
      The number of seconds passed since the start of instantiating the world.
